ai-ja452:1.1_0: “Is it really true, Kāmabhū, that you,
ai-ja452:1.2_0: Such (?) does the same as to height,
ai-ja452:1.3_0: not so developed by developing it.
ai-ja452:1.4_0: Let you eat whatever you wish.”
ai-ja452:2.2_0: Having given up desire for the right time,
ai-ja452:2.4_0: I’ll be able to be free of defilements.
ai-ja452:3.1_0: having understood the time, who have died,
ai-ja452:3.3_0: I rose up into the lion’s mangoes.
ai-ja452:4.1_0: “Happy in happiness, ~ who do not do bad things,
ai-ja452:4.3_0: A very wise man, having a little thought about it,
ai-ja452:4.4_0: On what reason does suffering not make me suffering?”
ai-ja452:5.1_0: “The Wise One does not hurt themselves,
ai-ja452:5.2_0: and doing good deeds in the past.
ai-ja452:7.1_0: “Whoever has given up the tree for a long time,
ai-ja452:7.2_0: you’d sit down or lie down on it.
ai-ja452:7.3_0: But it wouldn’t look for food
ai-ja452:7.4_0: for one a deceiver of friends.
ai-ja452:8.1_0: Because a person living by Dhamma can understand
ai-ja452:8.2_0: That good people (can) dispel their doubt,
ai-ja452:8.3_0: That will be his refuge and support,
ai-ja452:9.2_0: An unrestrained monk is (also) not good,
ai-ja452:9.3_0: An inconsiderate King is not good,
ai-ja452:9.4_0: The Wise One is not good,
ai-ja452:11.1_0: he was born as the earth:
